intro: Clarkia stellata, commonly known as star Clarkia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other showy flowering plants. The plant produces striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red, with five petals arranged symmetrically. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows and open woodlands. Clarkia stellata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
